etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Richard Owen (1804–1892), comparative anatomist and palaeontologist. From hippopotamus + -oid

definitions: Designating the family Hippopotamidae or a mammal of this family; of or relating to this family. Also more generally: resembling a hippopotamus or that of a hippopotamus.
Any of the living and extinct mammals of the family Hippopotamidae.
